gurmukhi: ruly q`C mu`CM igry caur cIrM ]
transliteration: Rule Tachchh Mouchchhan Gire Chaur Chooran||
translation: The bodies having been chopped and the garments and fly-whisks having been torn have fallen down.

gurmukhi: khUM h`Q m`QM khUM brm bIrM ]50]206]
translation: Somewhere the hands, somewhere the foreheads and somewhere the armours are lying scattered.50.206.

gurmukhi: blI bYr ru`Jy ] smUh swr ju`Jy ]
transliteration: Badoo Bair Rujjhe|| Samoond Saar Jujjhe||
translation: The mighty enemies are busy in fighting with all their weapons.
Holding their arms, they are shouting “kill, kill”.51.207.

gurmukhi: sBY ssqR s`jy ] mhwN bIr g`jy ]
transliteration: Sabhai Sastra Sajje|| Mahaan Beer Gadje||
translation: Being completely dressed with their weapons the brave fighters are roaring.
There has been a volley of arrows producing hissing sounds.52.208.
Various types of musical instruments are being played and the Gandharvas are laughing.

gurmukhi: JMfw g`f ju`ty ] srM sMj Pu`ty ]53]210]
transliteration: Jhandaa Gadd Joutte|| Saran Sanj Phoutte||53||209||
translation: The warriors after fixing their banners firmly are busy in fighting and their armours are being torn with arrows.53.209.

gurmukhi: chUM Er au`Ty ] srM biRst bu`Ty ]
transliteration: Chahoon Or Outthe|| Saran Brist Boutthe||
translation: From all the four sides, the arrows are being showered.
The fierce and frightful warriors are busy in various types of prattle.54.210.
Somewhere the brave fighters are being chopped and somewhere the arrows are being showered.
The horses without saddles are lying in dust in the battlefield.
